availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Kentucky
McLean county } Sct.

I Douglas Little presiding Judge for McLean county ^Kentucky^ do certify that Oliver P. Johnson ^personally^ appeared before me and took the following oath To Wit: I Joseph Cox do solemnly Swear that I will faithfully support the constitution of the United states and the constitution of Kentucky and will discharge all and singular the duties appertaining to the office of Captain in the Volunteer Militia agreeably to the law and general regulations and will obey such orders and instructions as I shall from time to time receive from the proper officers Which is hereby certified to general head quarters
Given under my hand at Calhoon Ky this 23rd day of November 1861

Douglas Little
P. J. McLean County

J T Kennard Ad KV
Lewis Arnold Chaplain
Noah Morris 1st Leiut
W M Houchin Capt
J J Washer 2d Lieut
W Hanway 1st Lieut.
W R Willis 2d Lieut
Reno Qr Master
J Atkison 2d Lieut
N M Peay Captain
J Kimbly Surgeon
x Hawkins Col
E C Phelps Capt
J B Tyler Capt
E L Motley Major
E R Weir Capt "
J W Tyler 1st L.t.
O P Johnson 1st Lieut "
Isaac W Sketo cap.
Jesee K Freeman 1st Leut.
Addison Turner 2nd Leut.
